sentences.english: He also puts forward some countermeasures for China coal industry in heavy chemical industry period.
sentences.chinese: 提出了重化工業時期我國煤炭工業應採取的對策。

sentences.english: In the late 18th century coal became one of the most sought-after natural resources.
sentences.chinese: 十八世紀末期，煤炭成爲最搶手的自然資源。

sentences.english: Energy-security experts still expected its exports to increase.
sentences.chinese: 能源安全專家預計中國的煤炭出口仍會增加。

sentences.english: People use coal to heat the house and generate electricity.
sentences.chinese: 人們使用煤炭來給房子取曖和發電。

sentences.english: A cargo of coal has arrived from Keelung.
The middle south plain area is the main area of coal exploitation in Shandong Province.
sentences.chinese: 魯中南地區是山東省煤炭資源開發的重點地區。

sentences.english: A coal mining in thin seam is an inevitable issue of coal mining in many coal mines.
sentences.chinese: 薄煤層開採是許多礦井煤炭開採中不可避免的問題。

sentences.english: This paper expounds the application of the statistical work in the management of coal transportation and marketing.
sentences.chinese: 陳述了統計工作在煤炭運銷管理中的應用。

sentences.english: A man salvages coal at a cinder dump site in Changzhi, Shanxi province China.
sentences.chinese: 在山西長治，一名在煤渣運送帶旁挑選煤炭的男子。

sentences.english: The heyday of the coal market is far from over.
sentences.chinese: 煤炭市場全盛時期的結束還離我們很遠。

sentences.english: Part five is standard design of financial reporting in extractive coal industry .
sentences.chinese: 第五部分爲煤炭採掘業財務報告準則設計。

sentences.english: Although China has coal supplies, they are of low quality
sentences.chinese: 儘管中國自身出產煤炭資源，質量卻相當低。

sentences.english: Munger says there's an environmental reason for being pro-coal compared to biofossil fuels.
sentences.chinese: 芒格說，將煤炭和生物能源比較有環保的原因。

sentences.english: But coal is still king in China.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在中國，煤炭依然是王者。

sentences.english: The trains carrying coal to power plants are death trains.
sentences.chinese: 將煤炭運輸到發電廠的列車堪稱死亡列車。

sentences.english: Coal reserves of 27 million tons above, mercury for heavy deposit.
sentences.chinese: 煤炭儲量2700萬噸以上，汞爲萬噸級特大礦牀。

definition: non-ferrous metals (all metals excluding iron, chromium, manganese and their alloys)
chemical industry, abbr. of 化學工業|化学工业[hua4 xue2 gong1 ye4]/chemical engineering, abbr. of 化學工程|化学工程[hua4 xue2 gong1 cheng2]
coking/the process of producing coke from coal
fuel gas (coal gas, natural gas, methane etc)
